channel.title: Help me choose some headphones
channel.description: I haven't done too much research, but I'll let you guys know what I'm looking for. Preferably over/on-ear headphones, and black/grey/white colour scheme. I'm looking at a budget of $100, nothing too fancy. I'm mainly concerned with comfort, colour, and lifetime under a moderate amount of usage. Nothing wireless/bluetooth unless it has the option for a cord as well. I've looked at JBL and Sony so far, but I'm open as to any other brands that look promising. Feel free to post an eBay link to a particular product as well. Thanks. :)

item.title: Help me choose some headphones
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:19, topic:535260”][quote author=naseem142 link=topic=654063.msg4397792#msg4397792 date=1389648982]

I own these: http://www.razerzone.com/gaming-audio/razer-kraken/

They are very comfortable to wear and very good sound quality but you can see all the specs in the link , i have owned them so far for almost a year and still perfect but the best of all they cost only 80$.

There also other ones from the same company:
http://www.razerzone.com/gaming-audio/kraken

Its up to you to decide i’m just suggesting.

Good sound quality but no surround sound? Kay…

It does have suround sound …
Just forgot to mention it

The Kraken and Kraken Pro do not.

I own the pro ones , and i’m pretty sure they do. Even you can install a driver to edit suround sound options… which i did
[/quote]
Virtualized by Windows is not the same as true Dolby 5.1 or 7.1[/quote]

Touche…

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose some headphones
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Thanks guys for the suggestions, but I got a pair of headphones already in late November.
For anyone wondering:

They’re a wireless pair, with the option for a cord, they’re from Sharper Image. I got them as a Hanukkah gift, they have decent sound and they serve their purpose quite well; I can listen to music with them for a few hours at a time comfortably.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose some headphones
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“TinyScape, post:7, topic:535260”]With the volume half way up (probably a little lower than half way too) people around you will be able to hear what you’re listening to clearly. I think its the vents on the cups though.[/quote]oh darn those wouldn’t work for me

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose some headphones
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

TinyScape:

With the volume half way up (probably a little lower than half way too) people around you will be able to hear what you’re listening to clearly. I think its the vents on the cups though.

Oh, alright. I don’t keep my volume up too loud anyways, so if I do end up getting those I probably (and hopefully!) won’t run into anything like that.
Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose some headphones
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Arcik:

dre beats

I’ve had them in the past, they’re not as great as they are made out to be. Monster does have decent customer support though; when I damaged an older pair of mine I had a new set in under a month.

[quote=“TinyScape, post:4, topic:535260”]I’ve got these:
http://www.amazon.com/Sony-MDR-XB500-Diaphragm-Driver-Headphones/dp/B001RB24S2/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1383685681&sr=8-1&keywords=sony+mdr+xb500

They’ve got great bass and are very comfortable.

Downside is they leak a lot.[/quote]
Those look pretty comfortable, good share. What do you mean by “leak,” though?

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose some headphones
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

They look nice, and that’s great that there is an option for wireless. The weight doesn’t bother me too much unless it has some parts that constantly rub against my ears/head.
Thanks for the share.

Two more headphones just suggested by iCreatedHorror: here and here.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me choose some headphones
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I have these headphones: Sony PS3 Pulse 7.1 wireless headset elite edition.
It’s a little out of your budget but I love them. I don’t even own a PS3 lol. It does have a single wire and the wireless is optional. They are a little heavy and become uncomfortable after a few hours.

Read full topic
